intro: Cleome quinquenervia var. noeana, commonly known as the yellow cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellow, five-petaled flowers. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. This species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant blooms.
